text:
Champions League
Manchester City: Guardiola admits to having trembled!
In front of Atalanta Bergamo, the coach of the Citizens had to change twice goalkeeper following the injury of Ederson and the expulsion of Claudio Bravo (1-1)
07 Nov 2019, 07:40 by Charlie Creteur



Held in check by Atalanta Bergamo (1-1), Manchester City coach Pep Guardiola had to line up in goals just minutes from the end of the game, defender Kyle Walker. Indeed, Ederson was out at halftime on injury for Claudio Bravo who was sent off (81st). A situation that did not reassure the former coach of FC Barcelona.




Pep Guardiola was scared!




Kyle Walker + 20 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

"If I already had 3 different goalkeepers in the same match?", He said. "If I was scared?" Yes, of course, there were still 10 minutes left and we could think about the worst, but we reacted with a single shot against us, and in the first half we played very well. ] Ederson was a little injured in the leg, I did some bullshit in my life, but never to replace a guardian if he is well. In the end, the two teams were separated by 1-1!
¬†Kyle Walker: all information about the player
